member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCommand
member.summary: An abstract class designed to provide an efficient way to create new custom command items. Inherit BaseCommand to create a new custom command.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: You must override the OnCreate method; generally in this method you should store a reference to the command host which is passed as a parameter to this method. Override the OnClick method and add the code which performs the main actions of your custom command class.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCommand.m_bitmap
member.summary: The bitmap that is used as the icon on this command, returned by the ICommand::Bitmap property. Null by default.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Set this field to the icon you wish to be used as the icon for the command. This value will be converted to an OLE picture handle the first time that the ICommand::Bitmap property is accessed. This handle is cleared from memory in the class destructor. Use the method to update this value once set.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCommand.m_caption
member.summary: The caption of this command, returned by the ICommand::Caption property. Null by default.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Set this field to a value you wish to be used as the caption for the command.

member.summary: The name of the category with which the command is associated, returned by the ICommand::Category property. Null by default.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Set this field to a value you wish to be used as the command category for the command.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer
member.summary: An abstract base class for implementation of a custom globe layer

member.summary: The class version number

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.DeleteObject(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: a win32 delete object reference

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.m_extent
member.summary: Keep the layer's extent. Returned by the IGeoDataset::Extent property
member.remarks: The extent should be spatial-referenced to the DateFrame's spatial reference.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.m_spRef
member.summary: Store the layer's underlying data spatial reference. Returned by IGeoDataset::SpatialReference.
member.remarks: This spatial reference should not be modified. Class member m_mapSpatialRef holds the map's spatial reference and should be used in order to implement reprojection on the fly.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.m_mapSpatialRef
member.summary: Store the maps's spatial reference. Set by ILayer::SpatialReference.
member.remarks: This spatial reference is set by the map. In order to support reprojection on the fly, you should make sure that both class members m_spatialRef and m_mapSpatialRef are not null and that each member holds different spatial reference (you can check that the factory code is different). Then you can use method IGeometry.Project in order to reproject your geometries when the layer draw.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.m_legendGroup

member.summary: The spatial reference of the underlying data.

member.summary: Last maximum scale setting used by layer.

member.summary: Description for the layer.

member.summary: The ID of the object.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.ShowTips
member.summary: Indicates if the layer shows map tips.
member.remarks: Indicates whether or not map tips are shown for the layer. If set to True, then map tips will be shown for the layer. You can determine the text that will be shown via TipText.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.AreaOfInterest
member.summary: The default area of interest for the layer. Returns the spatial-referenced extent of the layer.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.Visible
member.summary: Indicates if the layer is currently visible.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.Cached
member.summary: Indicates if the layer needs its own display cache.
member.remarks: This property indicates whether or not the layer requires its own display cache. If this property is True, then the Map will use a separate display cache for the layer so that it can be refreshed indpendently of other layers.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.MinimumScale
member.summary: Minimum scale (representative fraction) at which the layer will display.
member.remarks: Specifies the minimum scale at which the layer will be displayed. This means that if you zoom out beyond this scale, the layer will not display. For example, specify 1000 to have the layer not display when zoomed out beyond 1:1000.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.Valid
member.summary: Indicates if the layer is currently valid.
member.remarks: The valid property indicates if the layer is currently valid. Layers that reference feature classes are valid when they hold a reference to a valid feature class. The property does not however validate the integrity of the feature classes reference to the database. Therefore, in rare situations if a datasource is removed after a layer is initialized, the layer will report itself as valid but query attempts to the data source will error due to the lack of underlying data.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.Name
member.summary: The Layer name.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.MaximumScale
member.summary: Maximum scale (representative fraction) at which the layer will display.
member.remarks: Specifies the maximum scale at which the layer will be displayed. This means that if you zoom in beyond this scale, the layer will not display. For example, specify 500 to have the layer not display when zoomed in beyond 1:500.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.SupportedDrawPhases
member.summary: Supported draw phases.
member.remarks: Indicates the draw phases supported by the layer (esriDPGeography, esriDPAnnotation, esriDPSelection, or any combination of the three). The supported draw phases are defined by esriDrawPhase. When multiple draw phases are supported, the sum of the constants is used. For example, if SupportedDrawPhases = 3 then the layer supports drawing in the geography and annotation phases.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.ESRI#ArcGIS#Carto#ILayer#SpatialReference
member.summary: Spatial reference for the layer.
member.remarks: This property is only used for map display, setting this property does not change the spatial reference of the layer's underlying data. The ArcGIS framework uses this property to pass the spatial reference from the map to the layer in order to support on-the-fly projection.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.ExtensionCount
member.summary: Number of extensions.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.SmallImage
member.summary: Small image that represents the layer.
member.remarks: The icon used to represent the layer in ArcCatalog's 'List' and 'Details' views.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.LargeSelectedImage
member.summary: Large image that represents the layer when it is selected.
member.remarks: The icon used to represent the layer when it is selected in ArcCatalog's 'Large Icon' view.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.SmallSelectedImage
member.summary: Small image that represents the layer when it is selected.
member.remarks: The icon used to represent the layer when it is selected in ArcCatalog's 'List' and 'Details' views.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.LargeImage
member.summary: Large image that represents the layer.
member.remarks: The icon used to represent the layer in ArcCatalog's 'Large Icon' view.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.LegendGroupCount
member.summary: Number of legend groups contained by the object.
member.remarks: The number of legend groups is determined by the implementation of the renderer, consequently this property is read only. For example, SimpleRenderer has one group, while a BiUniqueValueRenderer has any number of groups.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.LegendItem
member.summary: Optional. Defines legend formatting for layer rendered with this object.
member.remarks: Layer or renderer legend information is further formatted for display in ArcMap legends. A renderer can override this formatting by returning a LegendItem for this property. ESRI renderers typically do not return anything for this property. With this configuration, legend formatting becomes a user or developer choice on the legend object.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.SymbolsAreGraduated
member.summary: Indicates if symbols are graduated.
member.remarks: For example the proportional symbol renderer returns True for this property. You can use this property to distinguish between a layer symbolized with graduated color or graduated symbol type layer symbology. Both of these symbolizations use a ClassBreaksRenderer, but only a graduated symbol symbolization will return True for this property.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.DrawType
member.summary: The custom draw method.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.MinimumCellSize
member.summary: For rasterized types, defines highest resolution. Zero value indicates that globe-generated default value should be used.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.SymbologyScalingFactor
member.summary: The symbol scale factor for the custom rasterized type.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.UseCache
member.summary: The option to use Globe's disk caching.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.HandlesLocalOrigin
member.summary: The option to use a local coordinate system origin for high precision drawing
member.remarks: Use this option (set to 'true') in case where you need to draw elements which are either small and close to the globe's surface.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomGlobeLayer.LocalOrigin
member.summary: The local coordinate system origin for high precision drawing
member.remarks: In case of setting the HandlesLocalOrigin to 'true', The point of origin passed by the Globe.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer
member.summary: Summary description for clsCustomLayer.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.c_Version
member.summary: The class version number

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.m_extent
member.summary: Keep the layer's extent. Returned by the IGeoDataset::Extent property
member.remarks: The extent should be spatial-referenced to the DateFrame's spatial reference.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.m_spatialRef
member.summary: Store the layer's underlying data spatial reference. Returned by IGeoDataset::SpatialReference.
member.remarks: This spatial reference should not be modified. Class member m_mapSpatialRef holds the map's spatial reference and should be used in order to implement reprojection on the fly.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.m_mapSpatialRef
member.summary: Store the maps's spatial reference. Set by ILayer::SpatialReference.
member.remarks: This spatial reference is set by the map. In order to support reprojection on the fly, you should make sure that both class members m_spatialRef and m_mapSpatialRef are not null and that each member holds different spatial reference (you can check that the factory code is different). Then you can use method IGeometry.Project in order to reproject your geometries when the layer draw.

member.summary: Layer's name. Returned by ILayer::Name property

member.summary: Flag which determines whether the layers is visible. Returned by ILayer::Visible
member.remarks: You should use this member in your inherited class in the Draw method.

member.summary: The spatial reference of the underlying data.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.ID
member.summary: The ID of the object.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.ShowTips
member.summary: Indicates if the layer shows map tips.
member.remarks: Indicates whether or not map tips are shown for the layer. If set to True, then map tips will be shown for the layer. You can determine the text that will be shown via TipText.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.AreaOfInterest
member.summary: The default area of interest for the layer. Returns the spatial-referenced extent of the layer.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.Visible
member.summary: Indicates if the layer is currently visible.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.Cached
member.summary: Indicates if the layer needs its own display cache.
member.remarks: This property indicates whether or not the layer requires its own display cache. If this property is True, then the Map will use a separate display cache for the layer so that it can be refreshed indpendently of other layers.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.MinimumScale
member.summary: Minimum scale (representative fraction) at which the layer will display.
member.remarks: Specifies the minimum scale at which the layer will be displayed. This means that if you zoom out beyond this scale, the layer will not display. For example, specify 1000 to have the layer not display when zoomed out beyond 1:1000.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.Valid
member.summary: Indicates if the layer is currently valid.
member.remarks: The valid property indicates if the layer is currently valid. Layers that reference feature classes are valid when they hold a reference to a valid feature class. The property does not however validate the integrity of the feature classes reference to the database. Therefore, in rare situations if a datasource is removed after a layer is initialized, the layer will report itself as valid but query attempts to the data source will error due to the lack of underlying data.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.Name
member.summary: The Layer name.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.MaximumScale
member.summary: Maximum scale (representative fraction) at which the layer will display.
member.remarks: Specifies the maximum scale at which the layer will be displayed. This means that if you zoom in beyond this scale, the layer will not display. For example, specify 500 to have the layer not display when zoomed in beyond 1:500.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseCustomLayer.SupportedDrawPhases
member.summary: Supported draw phases.
member.remarks: Indicates the draw phases supported by the layer (esriDPGeography, esriDPAnnotation, esriDPSelection, or any combination of the three). The supported draw phases are defined by esriDrawPhase. When multiple draw phases are supported, the sum of the constants is used. For example, if SupportedDrawPhases = 3 then the layer supports drawing in the geography and annotation phases.

member.remarks: This property is only used for map display, setting this property does not change the spatial reference of the layer's underlying data. The ArcGIS framework uses this property to pass the spatial reference from the map to the layer in order to support on-the-fly projection.

member.summary: Specifies whether or not the layer uses a filter.

members.member:
BaseDynamicLayer serves as a BaseClass for DynamicLayers.
In order to implemet a DynamicLayer using this base-class, the user has to inherit this base class and override method DrawDynamicLayer(). //BaseCustomLayer

member.summary: The class version number

member.remarks: The extent should be spatial-referenced to the DateFrame's spatial reference.

member.summary: Store the layer's underlying data spatial reference. Returned by IGeoDataset::SpatialReference.
member.remarks: This spatial reference should not be modified. Class member m_mapSpatialRef holds the map's spatial reference and should be used in order to implement reprojection on the fly.

member.summary: Store the maps's spatial reference. Set by ILayer::SpatialReference.
member.remarks: This spatial reference is set by the map. In order to support reprojection on the fly, you should make sure that both class members m_spatialRef and m_mapSpatialRef are not null and that each member holds different spatial reference (you can check that the factory code is different). Then you can use method IGeometry.Project in order to reproject your geometries when the layer draw.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool
member.summary: An abstract class designed to provide an efficient way to create new tool classes for ArcGIS. Inherit BaseTool to create a new custom tool. This class derives from the BaseCommand class.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: You must override the OnCreate method, inherited from BaseCommand. Generally you will also override the OnMouseDown, OnMouseMove and/or OnMouseUp methods of the BaseTool and in those members perform the main actions of your custom tool class.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.m_cursor
member.summary: A System.Windows.Forms.Cursor that is used for this tool, the handle of which is returned by the ITool::Cursor property. Null by default, indicating the default cursor will be used.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Change the m_cursor field to show a different cursor for your tool's mouse pointer. For example, if you a coding a tool which allows a user to track a rectangle, you may want to change the cursor whilst the mouse button is depressed to indicate the change of state to the user.

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.m_deactivate
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the Tool is deactivated, returned from the ITool::Deactivate method. True by default.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Set this field to indicate if the tool can be interrupted by other tools.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor. Initializes a new BaseTool object with default values.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.String,System.String,System.Windows.Forms.Cursor,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new BaseTool object from the specified bitmap, caption, category, cursor, help context ID, helpfile name, message, name, and tooltip.
member.param: System.Drawing.Bitmap for the tool icon.
Caption of the tool.
Category of the tool.
System.Windows.Forms.Cursor for the tool.
Help context ID for the tool.
Helpfile name for the tool.
Message of the tool.
Name of the tool.
Tooltip of the tool.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Use this constructor to set up the values of the tool.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.OnMouseDown(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called when a mouse button is pressed down, when this tool is active.
member.param: Specifies which mouse button is pressed; 1 for the left mouse button, 2 for the right mouse button, and 4 for the middle mouse button.

Specifies an integer corresponding to the state of the SHIFT (bit 0), CTRL (bit 1) and ALT (bit 2) keys. When none, some, or all of these keys are pressed none, some, or all the bits get set. These bits correspond to the values 1, 2, and 4, respectively. For example, if both SHIFT and ALT were pressed, Shift would be 5.
The X coordinate, in device units, of the location of the mouse event. See the OnMouseDown Event for more details.
The Y coordinate, in device units, of the location of the mouse event. See the OnMouseDown Event for more details.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Override the OnMouseDown method if you need to perform some action when the OnMouseDown is raised when the tool is active.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.OnMouseUp(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called when a mouse button is released, when this tool is active.
member.param: Specifies which mouse button is released; 1 for the left mouse button, 2 for the right mouse button, and 4 for the middle mouse button.

Specifies an integer corresponding to the state of the SHIFT (bit 0), CTRL (bit 1) and ALT (bit 2) keys. When none, some, or all of these keys are pressed none, some, or all the bits get set. These bits correspond to the values 1, 2, and 4, respectively. For example, if both SHIFT and ALT were pressed, Shift would be 5.
The X coordinate, in device units, of the location of the mouse event. See the OnMouseUp Event for more details.
The Y coordinate, in device units, of the location of the mouse event. See the OnMouseUp Event for more details.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Override the OnMouseUp method if you need to perform some action when the OnMouseUp event is raised when the tool is active.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.OnKeyDown(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called when a key is pressed down, when this tool is active.
member.param: Specifies a virtual key code value of the key pressed on the keyboard. For alpha-numeric keys this corresponds to the ASCII value, for example "A" key returns 65 which is the ASCII value for capital A. Other key codes are F1 to F12 are 112 to 123 respectively.

Specifies an integer corresponding to the state of the SHIFT (bit 0), CTRL (bit 1) and ALT (bit 2) keys. When none, some or all of these keys are pressed none, some or all the bits get set. These bits correspond to the values 1, 2, and 4, respectively. For example, if both SHIFT and ALT were pressed, Shift would be 5.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Override the OnKeyDown method if you need to perform some action when the OnKeyDown event is raised when the tool is active.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.OnKeyUp(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called when a key is released, when this tool is active.
member.param: Specifies a virtual key code value of the key released on the keyboard. For alpha-numeric keys this corresponds to the ASCII value, for example "A" key returns 65 which is the ASCII value for capital A. Other key codes are F1 to F12 are 112 to 123 respectively.

Specifies an integer corresponding to the state of the SHIFT (bit 0), CTRL (bit 1) and ALT (bit 2) keys. When none, some or all of these keys are pressed none, some or all the bits get set. These bits correspond to the values 1, 2, and 4, respectively. For example, if both SHIFT and ALT were pressed, Shift would be 5.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Override the OnKeyUp method if you need to perform some action when the OnKeyUp event is raised when the tool is active.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.OnMouseMove(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called when the mouse is moved while a mouse button is pressed down, when this tool is active.
member.param: Specifies which mouse button is pressed while the mouse is moved; 1 for the left mouse button, 2 for the right mouse button, and 4 for the middle mouse button.

Specifies an integer corresponding to the state of the SHIFT (bit 0), CTRL (bit 1) and ALT (bit 2) keys. When none, some, or all of these keys are pressed none, some, or all the bits get set. These bits correspond to the values 1, 2, and 4, respectively. For example, if both SHIFT and ALT were pressed, Shift would be 5.
The X coordinate, in device units, of the location of the mouse event. See the OnMouseMove Event for more details.
The Y coordinate, in device units, of the location of the mouse event. See the OnMouseMove Event for more details.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Override the OnMouseMove method if you need to perform some action when the OnMouseMove event is raised when the tool is active.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.OnContextMenu(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called when the context menu event is raised at the given location.
member.param: The X coordinate, in device units, of the location of the mouse event. See the OnContextMenu Event for more details.
The Y coordinate, in device units, of the location of the mouse event. See the OnContextMenu Event for more details.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating if the context menu event has been handled.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Override the OnContextMenu method if you need to perform some action when the OnContextMenu event is raised when the tool is active. By default, False is returned, indicating that the event has not been handled in the tool, and so the default context menu for the view will be displayed instead.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.Deactivate
member.summary: This method is called when the tool becomes inactive.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating if the tool can be interrupted by other tools.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: By default, the field is returned from this member. Override the Deactivate method if you need to alter this behaviour or perform some action when the Deactivate event is raised.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.Refresh(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called when a screen display in the application is refreshed, if the tool is active in that display.
member.param: The window handle to the display context which was refreshed.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Override the Refresh method if you need to perform some action when the display is refreshed when the tool is active.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.OnDblClick
member.summary: This method is called when the mouse is double-clicked when the tool is active.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: Override the OnDblClick method if you need to perform some action when the OnDblClick event is raised when the tool is active.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.BaseClasses.BaseTool.Cursor
member.summary: Gets the Cursor handle that is used as the mouse pointer for this tool, shown when this tool is the active tool.
member.remarks: Note to inheritors: By default, the cursor stored in the field is converted to a handle, and then returned from this member. It is possible to override this member, if you should need to provide a different implementation.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.COMSupport.AOUninitialize
member.summary: To help unload COM references in .NET apps, the AOUninitialize class provides the static (Shared in VB.NET) function Shutdown.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.COMSupport.AOUninitialize.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.COMSupport.AOUninitialize.Shutdown
member.summary: The AOUninitalize.Shutdown function canbe called to help clean up references to COM objects, when a process shuts down.
member.remarks: Although the Shutdown function handles many shutdown problems in standalone applications, but you may still experience problems as there are COM objects that require explicit releasing; in these cases, you may wish to refer to the class.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.COMSupport.OLE
member.summary: The OLE class defines methods to help you convert existing .NET Font, Bitmap or Icon classes into stdole Font or Picture objects to use in in ArcGIS members.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.COMSupport.OLE.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.COMSupport.OLE.GetIPictureDispFromIcon(System.Drawing.Icon)
member.summary: The GetIPictureDispFromIcon method can be used to convert an existing .NET System.Drawing.Icon object into a Stdole.StdPicture object.
member.param: A object.

div.code: Dim dotNetIcon As System.Drawing.Icon = New System.Drawing.Icon("C:\Temp\MyIcon.ico") Dim map As ESRI.ArcGIS.MapControl.IMapControlDefault = Me.AxMapControl1.Object map.MouseIcon = ESRI.ArcGIS.Utility.COMSupport.OLE.GetIPictureDispFromIcon(dotNetIcon) map.MousePointer = ESRI.ArcGIS.SystemUI.esriControlsMousePointer.esriPointerCustom

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.COMSupport.OLE.GetIPictureDispFromBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap)

div.code: Dim dotNetBmp As System.Drawing.Bitmap = New System.Drawing.Bitmap("C:\Temp\MyBitmap.bmp") Dim bmpSym As ESRI.ArcGIS.Display.IPictureMarkerSymbol = New ESRI.ArcGIS.Display.PictureMarkerSymbol bmpSym.Picture = ESRI.ArcGIS.Utility.COMSupport.OLE.GetIPictureDispFromBitmap(dotNetBmp)

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.COMSupport.OLE.GetIFontDispFromFont(System.Drawing.Font)

div.code: Dim dotNetFont As New System.Drawing.Font("Castellar", 25.0F) Dim textSym As ESRI.ArcGIS.Display.ITextSymbol = New ESRI.ArcGIS.Display.TextSymbolClass textSym.Font = ESRI.ArcGIS.Utility.COMSupport.OLE.GetIFontDispFromFont(dotNetFont)
